metadata.dcterms:title: Reduction of Radial Head Subluxation in Children Via a Nurse Initiated Pathway: A Clustered Randomized Control Trial
metadata.dcterms:creator: Dixon, Andrew
Plint, Amy
Osmond, Martin
Barrowman, Nick
Correll, Rhonda
Clarkin, Chantalle
metadata.dcterms:description: The study's objective was to examine whether triage nurses, trained in the use of a medical directive that taught recognition and treatment of radial head subluxation, could successfully reduce radial head subluxation at a rate similar to physicians. Given the practical constraints at the time of emergency department triage, this study was designed as a cluster randomized trial where the unit of randomization was a day and the patients on any given day were assigned to the nurse or physician arm for the entire day.
